intro: Amsinckia leptosperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. It produces small, elongated seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to thrive in arid environments.
